title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But Cressingham, the treasurer, who was ignorant and presumptuous, insisted that it was their duty to fight,and put an end to the war at once ; and Lundingave way to his opinion, although Cressingham,being a churchman, could not be so good a judgeof what was fitting as he himself, an experiencedofficer.
